Charles Sturt University
Master of Corporate Biotechnology

Interested in a career in Corporate Biotechnology? Why pursue a Master of Corporate Biotechnology degree? How long does it take? Admission requirements How do Iapply? What will Ilearn? More information

Master of Corporate Biotechnology: At A Glance Credential(s) Earned Master's Degree Program Length 3-6 years Delivery Method Distance education Start Date * Winter Session: February 2006 Approximate Tuition AUD$1,300/course Application Deadline Winter Session: October 30, 2005 Apply Through Charles Sturt University
* There is only one intake per year for this program
Why should Ipursue my Master of Corporate Biotechnology degree?

The Master of Corporate Biotechnology has been developed to provide professional development within a relevant, up-to-date post-graduate qualification that combines the science, business, Information Technology and law components of biotechnology that are vital to the development and commercialization of biotechnology research. This course has been structured to suit applicants working in both the business sector of the biotechnology industry (with a previous business, law or Information Technology degree) and those working in the research sector of the biotechnology industry (with a previous biotechnology or biological sciences degree).
How long does it take?

There is one intake per year, in February, and the program normally takes three years of part-time study. Each year is divided into two semesters, Winter (February to June) and Summer (July to November), and you may take a maximum of two courses per semester. You may also take one course per semester, completing the degree in 6 years.
Start Date
Winter Session: February 2006
Admission Requirements and Credit

Business/Law/IT graduate stream : Business, Law or IT Bachelor degree and a minimum of 2 years current professional experience. Graduates in Business/Law/IT do not have the option of entering the Biotechnology graduate stream, nor are they eligible for credits based solely on a prior undergraduate Business, Law or IT degree.
OR

Biotechnology graduate stream : Biotechnology or equivalent Medical/Biological Science Bachelor degree and a minimum of 2 years relevant employment.  Graduates in Biological Sciences do not have the option of entering the Business, Law or IT graduate stream, nor are they eligible for credits based solely on a prior undergraduate Biotechnology/Biological Science degree All applicants must meet the English Language Requirements for Charles Sturt University
Tuition
Tuition is paid on a course-by-course basis, and you may take a maximum of two courses per semester. 2005/06 tuition fees are AUD$1300 per Master's level course.
How do Iapply?
To apply please collect the following documents:
Acompleted CSU Application Form (56k - pdf) Copies of all your post-secondary educational material, including transcripts Other documentation and resume outlining your education and experience
And submit them to:
Frances Van Wel Faculty Liaison Officer CSU International Charles Sturt University Locked Bag 669 Wagga Wagga  NSW  2678 AUSTRALIA Tel: +61 2 69 332599 Fax: + 61 2 69 332799 Email: fvanwel@csu.edu.au

Once accepted, simply submit payment for your first semester courses to Charles Sturt University. Course material will be sent to you in time for the start of the semester. Payment options will be outlined in your letter of offer. After reviewing your application, CSU will inform you if you have been accepted into the program.
What will Ilearn?

The Master of Corporate Biotechnology caters to candidates with varied backgrounds by utilizing alternative strands in the first year of the program.  Those candidates with a law, IT or business background will gain a good understanding of the science behind biotechnology while those candidates with a previous degree in biotechnology (or equivalent) will use the first year to gain a solid understanding of relevant issues in law, business and information technology.  Both cohorts will merge for the remaining subjects. Research projects can be specifically tailored to the needs of each candidate with projects available in each of the key areas of science, bioinformatics, business, law and intellectual property.  The course pattern for each cohort is shown below.
Business, Law or IT Graduate Stream Biotechnology/Biological Science Graduate Stream Winter Year 1 Fundamentals of Biotechnology (16 points)
Commercial Law Management Theory and Practice
Summer Year 1 Techniques in Genetic Engineering (16 points)
Information Systems for Health Services Management Commercial Law
Winter Year 2
Bioinformatics and Proteomics Ethics, Law & Medical Science Bioinformatics and Proteomics Ethics, Law & Medical Science
Summer Year 2
Laboratory Quality Control Biomedical Research Methods Laboratory Quality Control Biomedical Research Methods
Winter Year 3
Research Proposal Intellectual Property and Patent Law Research Proposal Intellectual Property and Patent Law
Summer Year 3 Project and Dissertation (2 subjects, 16 points) Project and Dissertation (2 subjects, 16 points)
